item.title: why vim
item.description: hmm Programmers are writers, it could be argued that we think more than we write. But at the end of the day, writing is how something becomes real.

item.title: cargo-wix
item.description: cargo-wix is a tool to create windows installers. if there are multiple .exe files where main.exe depends on the others, a bundle can be created.

item.title: creating a mac installer
item.description: install builder uses click install app to build the installer but it’s too expensive dcp setup maker could another solution.

item.title: docker
item.description: website Docker is a tool that makes setting up environments for software to run on any platform reliably. It does this by packaging the source code along with all its dependencies defined in a [[dev_notes/Dockerfile]].

item.title: docker image
item.description: A [[dev_notes/docker]] container image is a lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings.

item.title: docker-compose
item.description: docs docker-compose is a tool that allows for management of multiple docker containers. It is basically a [[dev_notes/docker]] container container other subcontainers that makes it easy for the subcontainers to communicate with each other.

item.title: dockerhub
item.description: website A service that host docker images and manage versions. Functions similarly to github.

item.title: git submodules subtress
item.description: blog docs A way to manage cases where a project is needed within another project, and still be able to treat them as separate git repositories.

item.title: helix editor
item.description: website github note I saw the zee “terminal” text editor but it was mainly inspired by emacs… not for me.

item.title: lazygit
item.description: github nice git terminal UI installing in ubuntu: 1 2 3 sudo add-apt-repository ppa:lazygit-team/daily sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install lazygit

item.title: meilisearch
item.description: website a search engine built with rust

item.title: nvm
item.description: nvm node version manager. helpful when working with projects that use specific node versions.

item.title: outline css debugging
item.description: quick way to add outlines for all html elements to check for overflows for example. ![[attachments/Pasted image 20230504190419.png]] use the plus icon to add a new css rule with the * selector:

item.title: setup_nvim_with_packer
item.description: gonna look at theprimeagen dot files lua/configs/etc.lua init.vim -> lua require('configs')

item.title: skim_rs
item.description: skim - like fzf but written in rust! https://williamhuey.github.io/posts/rust-fzf-alternative-skim/ i don’t understand how to used it properly within vim yet

item.title: trunk
item.description: https://trunk.io/ Trunk simplifies checking, testing, and merging your code, allowing you to focus on writing features instead of babysitting PRs.

item.title: vim-copy-paste
item.description: Copying from vim to system clipboard is very useful. It can be tricky though. I only started using it recently.
